newsitem.title: INDIA: India rupee ends slightly up vs dlr in dull trade.
newsitem.headline: India rupee ends slightly up vs dlr in dull trade.

text.p: The Indian rupee ended Thursday at 35.71/72 per dollar against the day's opening 35.72/73, dealers said.
In dull trade, the rupee was range bound between a high of 35.715 per dollar and a low of 35.73, they said.
The Reserve Bank of India bought dollars at 35.7175 and 35.72 rupees, dealers said.
In the forward section, the premia for six-month dollars ended Thursday at an annualised rate of 10.36 percent against Wednesday's close of 10.42 percent, dealers said.
